description:
Kei Nagai’s body should have died when a truck slams into his body, but instead, he finds himself resurrected with all of his wounds healed. Now revealed to be an Ajin, one of a mysterious new breed of immortal demi-human, he’s been marked with an international bounty, and in the eyes of the world, Kei is a specimen to be taken by any means possible. Now he’s on the run, and his only hope is to discover the terrifying secrets behind his new abilities before he’s forced to use them in battle!

(Source: Sentai Filmworks)
synonyms: อาจิน สายพันธุ์อมนุษย์

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Terrorism
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a terrorist or terrorist organization.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Cosmic Horror
tags.description: A type of horror that emphasizes human insignificance in the grand scope of cosmic reality; fearing the unknown and being powerless to fight it.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

node.description:
Flumpool is a Japanese rock band of four from Osaka. The name is a compound word of f from the English word four, since there are 4 members, along with the word meaning mass, lump, and the word pool. Flumpool falls under the label of A-Sketch.

Yamamura has been writing the lyrics for almost all of their songs and Sakai has been doing the composing.

Members:
• Ryuta Yamamura (山村 隆太) - vocals, guitar
• Kazuki Sakai (阪井 一生) - guitar
• Genki Amakawa (尼川 元気) - bass
• Seiji Ogura (小倉 誠司) - drums

(Source: MAL)
Hiroshi Seko is a screenwriter.
Hiroshi Seko is a screenwriter.
Hiroshi Seko is a screenwriter.
Hiroyuki Seshita is an animation director, CG director and director.
Originating from [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ihara0423)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/229166670/)

After graduating from the Department of Mechanical Engineering, Faculty of Engineering at Fukuoka University, he joined the animation studio [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/). There his first work as an in-betweener was on [Hiatari Ryoukou!](https://anilist.co/anime/729/). Afterwards, he went freelance and worked on films such as [Akira](https://anilist.co/anime/47/) and [Kiki's Delivery Service](https://anilist.co/anime/512/) before debuting as a key animator on [Lupin III: Bye Bye, Lady Liberty](https://anilist.co/anime/1415/) in 1989.

Him working on [Studio Ghibli](https://anilist.co/studio/21/)'s films as an animator led to him being selected as a director for [The Cat Returns](https://anilist.co/anime/597/). A movie which remains as one of his most noted works today. In 2007, he directed his first TV series, [Bokurano](https://anilist.co/anime/1690/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ando_beanjam)

Pioneered the cel shaded, expressive look that distinguishes [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/)'s CG work.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/118963142)
[Twitter](https://x.com/kazumi_nazirane)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ando_beanjam)

Pioneered the cel shaded, expressive look that distinguishes [Studio 4°C](https://anilist.co/studio/13/)'s CG work.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.

[Blog](http://b.dlsite.net/RG12220) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ggggggggggero) Gamon Sakurai is a Japanese manga artist from Tokyo. He was selected for the Afternoon Magazine Four Seasons Award in 2006 and won the grand prize in 2008 with [_A Soramimi_](https://anilist.co/manga/99070). Sakurai is also publishing adult manga under the other name of "GGGGGGGGGG" which is written as "G-10". He first intended to put his work as G-10 when asked to write his brief history for the profile on moae.jp, which was quickly stopped by a Kodansha editor. Personal life In the interview article from "Bishoujo Kakumei KIWAME" vol.15, Sakurai has cited [Katsuhiro Otomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872), [Hitoshi Iwaaki](https://anilist.co/staff/97377), [Ryouji Minagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98033), [Tetsuro Ueyama](https://anilist.co/staff/115721) and [Tatsuya Egawa](https://anilist.co/staff/98034) as the manga artists who have influenced him.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/167965047)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/235154812) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/30949)

Started out as amateur gif animator before turning professional. He initially failed an examination test for [Gainax](https://anilist.co/studio/6/) but was later scouted by the late [Osamu Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/100406/) for [Beck](https://anilist.co/anime/57/). There he met noted animators [Norio Matsumoto](https://anilist.co/staff/100991/) and [Satoru Utsunomiya](https://anilist.co/staff/101489/), the former which he would work with on numerous occasions afterwards.

His breakthrough as an animator was on [Noein](https://anilist.co/anime/584/), a series directed by [Kazuki Akane](https://anilist.co/staff/102416/). The 12th episode was highly regarded by animation fans and other animators for the given display by him and Matsumoto. He would later also serve as a character designer on [Birdy the Mighty: Decode](https://anilist.co/anime/3974/), another series directed by Akane.

His dedication for animation could also be seen on [The Girl Who Leapt Through Time](https://anilist.co/anime/2236/), for which he animated a minute-long scene of the main character running down a street. He went on the actual street in Tokyo to film himself for reference footage for the cut.
